<!-- source-hash: 4400696dbaad382dca212fcc461f904d -->
A custom runtime exception that is thrown when a log entry cannot be found during log retrieval operations. This exception extends `RuntimeException` to indicate an unchecked exception that typically occurs when attempting to access non-existent log records.

## Key Components

- **LogNotFoundException** - Main exception class that extends `RuntimeException`
- **Constructor** - Single parameterized constructor accepting a descriptive error message

## Usage Example

```java
// Service method that throws LogNotFoundException
public LogEntry getLogById(String logId) {
    LogEntry log = logRepository.findById(logId);
    if (log == null) {
        throw new LogNotFoundException("Log entry not found with ID: " + logId);
    }
    return log;
}

// Exception handling
try {
    LogEntry log = logService.getLogById("invalid-id");
} catch (LogNotFoundException e) {
    System.err.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());
    // Handle missing log scenario
}
```

This exception is typically used in logging services or repositories to provide clear error messaging when log retrieval operations fail due to missing or invalid log identifiers.
